Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
Author: Erin Elizabeth HerbertErin Elizabeth Herbert
Title: Arrived used with poop stains
Body: The diaper arrived used and was covered in poop stains. (See pics) Nothing could have been more disgusting!! I am assuming someone returned it after using it and the company simply did not check the item and then shipped it to us as if it was brand new. These were not small stains either. I was extremely grossed out. Thank god I saw the stains and didn’t put it on my baby! I will be returning this ASAP and I sure hope they check it out when they get it back but I wouldn’t be surprised if they just ship it to some other unsuspecting parent.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2018
Author: Etty P. Carcamo
Title: Perhaps I didn't use it correctly...
Body: I've only used it about 3 times. The first the babe got in the pool right away. On the second occasion I dressed him up with the swim diaper and his rash guard but I stayed on my bed for time waiting for my friend to be ready when I suddenly felt he was wet and that the pee had come out. I'm not sure if it was too loose and that is why it leaked so I will keep trying it and see if that was the case. The third time I got in the water right after so I experienced no problem. It is very well made, loved the colors and how it is adjustable so once I continue to use it I will write an update to see if it was my mistake or it didn't really work...

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2018
Author: Lugarda Parra
Title: Not waterproof
Body: We put this diaper on our baby under a bodysuit and by the time we walked to the beach he was completely wet from his pee.  I can imagine that poop might not get out, but it doesn't work if he's wet before getting in the water and his suit is full of pee.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020
Author: Elaine
Title: Too tight, did not hold poop, caused a rash, not easy to clean
Body: Used this for memorial day weekend at a lake with a beach. My son is 26 lbs and this was incredibly tight and odd fitting at the thighs. He didn't seem to mind but there would be NO WAY we would get any use out of it for more than a few months. I chocked it up to being tight so it would hold poop.Sadly it didn't even do that well. My son pooped and it seeped right out of the diaper (and all over my poor husband that was holding him at the time).Lastly, it touts that it prevents diaper rash. This gave my son the worst diaper rash of his whole life. And we did change him right away after he pooped too.It was also impossible to clean at the elastic leg seams. I had to run this through the wash three times using numerous stain treatments and the poop stain and smell held on. I'm going to soak it in vinegar next.I so wanted to like this, but I don't think I will ever use it again. So sad, $17 wasted.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2017
Author: Melissa P
Title: Wish they were accurate with sizing.
Body: I am very disapointed with how small it is. My son is almost 17months and weighs aporximately 25 pounds and it is so snug on him that i feel like it leave red marks if he wore for any length of time. They should not advertise it to fit older kids, because it clearly doesn't. I would guess it's more for around the six month mark. Other than that i would have been happy with product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2018
Author: cameron J.
Title: POOP everywhere
Body: I don't know why people have such good reviews here... my kids pooped once and it was a disaster. These things do not hold poop in. It was snugly on our baby and it leaked everywhere. I also should note that I noticed her face and knew she was trying to poop, so I pulled her out of the water before she really did some damage. Mostly it got on us (because the diaper sucks) but what little she did get out before I pulled her out of the pool was everywhere.  It was so traumatic. Lastly, I've washer the diaper now 3x and it still smells from the "incident"DO NOT BUY. Save yourself. They are totally cute, but totally NOT worth it. Go buy the little swimmers real diapers and save yourself

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
Author: Simplicity
Title: I purchased this because of all the wonderful reviews, however it just didn’t work for my ...
Body: I purchased this because of all the wonderful reviews, however it just didn’t work for my kiddo, even using it on the largest size, it was still super tight on the legs, and I don’t think my son is that chunky. Went with a different brand, better fit and better price. Was kinda of disappointing with this one and I think it’s a little overpriced as well.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020
Author: Karli J. Risk
Title: Not for chunky babies
Body: I chose this diaper because it is adjustable. My son is 10 months and 21 pounds. I put it on the largest snaps and it is very right around his waist and legs, I can’t see him being able to wear it for much longer. It’s done the job so far The two times he’s worn it but disappointed he’ll grow out of it so soon. It also smells horrid when he pees in it. Doesn’t even smell like pee I don’t know how to explain it.  It smells like it even after washing but then once it’s dried it smells ok, so strange

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2017
Author: Abot
Title: One Star
Body: Too tights on the thighs that left red marks on my baby's.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2018
Author: MtnmamaNM
Title: Cute, but not for chunky babies
Body: Unfortunately had to return- it’s very cute and seems well made, but did not fit around my son’s thighs, even at the largest setting! If you go to their website to read the fit instructions it actually says that it may not work for chunkier babies... wish I had known!  My son is 7months and around 20lbs (40th percentile for length and 75th for weight). Just FYI before you purchase... Would work well for skinnier babies. :)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2018
Author: James
Title: Expensive and waste of money
Body: My daughter had this on for 5 minutes while I was getting my bathing suit on and peed and it pored right out. Would have been very embrassing if I was on my way to the pool and her pee was pouring down my leg and all over as it was in the house. Expensive and waste of money! Do not buy, doesn’t absorb anything!,

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2017
Author: J D Ward
Title: Cute pattern but elastic wore out too soon
Body: I have mixed feelings about this swim diaper. First, the positives. This print is super cute and I loved how adjustable it is. In theory, it would fit our baby for several years. Unfortunately, after only about 6 months of use with him wearing it about 1-2 times a week and only rinsing and air drying, the swim diaper is shot. The elastic is loose around all the edges to the extent that it is no longer usable. I am highly disappointed as I was hoping to get several years of use out of this instead of just a few months. I had been thinking about buying another pattern but now I'll probably look elsewhere.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
Author: Mike Reed
Title: Fits great, but bleeds color even after washing.
Body: Fits great. Easy to put on kid while standing. Definitely holds a poop. My only issue is that the diapers are bleeding a copper-orange color. It stained a brand new swimsuit. Not sure why it does this or how to fix it. I would give 5 stars otherwise.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2017
Author: Sarah
Title: Runs small for our son
Body: Love the concept and looks adorable on my son. Would give a higher rating but found it ran really small or my son is an outlier and has a HUGE bottom. We don't really struggle with his clothing in sizes so I'm not sure what went wrong here

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2016
Author: Pedro
Title: One Star
Body: Way too small.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2018
Author: BTTL4ever
Title: Public Health Hazard Alert
Body: SORRY but babies should not be in swimming pools nor should anyone who has not bathed or showered before entering the water because cryptosporidium and other highly toxic and contagious pathogens are not killed by chlorine or other pool water disinfectants and there is no way to contain pathogens from fecal matter in the "swim" diaper inside of the diaper because the pool water circulates through the diaper and out for the general consumption of any other people in the pool. Maybe no one sees the poop the baby releases because they are too young to have any understanding of this bodily function or its appropriate place but there is NO EXCUSE FOR THE PARENTS to pollute the pool in order to prematurely introduce a baby to swimming. Help a child learn to love the water in a small family pool if you like where you can easily "start fresh" if they do what babies do. Also a baby is likely to swallow or get pool water in their mouths exposing them to pathogens which there is no good reason to put them in contact with. When they have mastered voluntary control of their bathroom habits, is plenty soon enough to begin to put them in communal bathing situations.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2015
Author: Gordon
Title: Great product
Body: The swim diapers are great, there are different patterns to choose from for boy or girl and plenty of snaps on the diapers to ensure tightness around the legs and waist and to allow them to grow with your child. They seem to be comfortable as our child has never complained with it on.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2016
Author: Matt Schuster
Title: good for its function, may not fit 35pounds
Body: We have a pool, so we need a reusable diaper. This is the first one I have ever tried and my 17month old has worn it 5-7 times now. We have yet to have a poopy incident, so I can not attest to its real function of keeping poop out of the pool. I like the snaps compared to other products which pull up (don't want to manage a poop while pulling a diaper down her legs :P ) but baby seems irritated when I try to apply the diaper. I have to snap the 2nd to last upper snap and last bottom snap to prevent red lines on her from diaper fitting too tight. She weights 24 pounds, so I'm concerned that this diaper wont fit her for the full 35pound advertised weight. I will probably try another brand to compare.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2017
Author: TNTV
Title: Would be too small for 20-month-old and up.
Body: I purchased this swim diaper last year for my then 6-month old son. We have been having several occasions and great time using it and I loved it. Even though he's never had any accidents in it- can't say how good it'd hold, but I enjoyed having the non-disposable option to save money in the long run. I do wish we'd be able to used it until he's 3 years old as advertised but unfortunately, no. I loved the diaper so much until recently, for the last 3 times using it when my son at 19 month old with the average weight of 24-25lbs, I noticed the diaper got too snug around his thighs, leaving the indentations even we used the outermost buttons. I just hope to find its new replacement that's just as good.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
Author: Casey Anderson
Title: Great product but not great fit
Body: It seems a lot of the reviewers don’t understand that swim diapers are not meant to hold pee. It’s super cute and nicely built but my son is skinny and only weighs 25 lbs. even on the biggest snap settings it kept falling down his waist and left very deep imprints on his skin. Besides the fit everything else was great. Will probably have to return as it doesn’t seem to comfortable on him.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2017
Author: S. Engelbrecht
Title: Permanent Poop Smell
Body: Used only once, and it did its job of keeping poo in the diaper and out of the pool -- which is why I gave it 2 stars. But I washed it immediately after, according to the care instructions, and it kept a permanent poop smell. I washed it 2 more times by machine and 2 more times by hand -- no luck. It still stinks so bad I can't bring myself to put it on my child again.It also fits too tight, even on the loosest setting, on my 50th percentile (normal weight) 1 year old. Bright red marks/indentations around the thighs, can't be comfortable.For what I paid for it, I'm very disappointed in its functionality.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2017
Author: Lorraine J
Title: Don't trust them!
Body: Don't make the mistake of putting baby in these and placing them in your lap! I ended up soaked. I was waiting a short time while other babies were being dressed - maybe 10 minutes. I know I cant expect them to act like a regular diaper but thought they would manage a little urine before I could get her in the water. Will stick with disposable swim diapers from now on.  Will give Two stars because they appear to be well made and cute but unfortunately that doesn't do it for me.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2017
Author: Natalee
Title: I like these, but it leaves kind of deep indentations ...
Body: I like these, but it leaves kind of deep indentations on my 18 month old's skin from the snaps. They are a little too snug on her, even at the loosest setting.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2017
Author: E. Trisch
Title: Terrible. Disappointed. Save your money.
Body: I don't usually write bad reviews. My son wasn't in this an hour and peed all over himself while we had his pool up and sprinklers going in the yard. Son is 14 months. Had the diaper on pretty tight to the point it left red marks when I took it off. Just on the second notch. He has a pretty small waist. Can't see how a normal toddler would feel comfortable even in the first notch... I think letting him go commando would have been more proficient than these. Definitely not something I would put on him at the public pool. I bought two with high hopes. Disappointed. I'll stick to my Little Swimmer disposables after trying these...

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
Author: Chelsey
Title: Three Stars
Body: So cute! But we had to return because it did not fit our 2 year old (36lbs).

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2017
Author: Geena Palos
Title: I bought this product for my 7 month old so ...
Body: I bought this product for my 7 month old so she could sit in a baby pool. I put her in it then in her carseat to drive to the park and when i took her out of her carseat she was soaking wet and my carseat was too- she was wet with pee because this diaper doesnt absorb anything! She also had pooped and she was a mess. Just from the short ride over there! I threw the diaper away because ill never use it again

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
Author: Amanda Mitchell
Title: Leaks!
Body: Put this on my son and then sat him on my lap. He peed and it went straight through on to me as if he were naked. What?! I checked to make sure it was on snuggly and so did my husband. It happened again at the pool. I went back to iplay. There’s isn’t adjustable but it works.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2016
Author: T_dub
Title: Three Stars
Body: Cute but small. It just barely fits my 1.5 year old who is 25lbs.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2018
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Ibought this because I heard great things about it from the reviews
Body: Ibought this because I heard great things about it from the reviews. Every time we use it my sons diaper is soaked when we get out of the pool and it weighs him down while swimming. I watched the “how to use” video on their site so I know I’m using it correctly.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2018
Author: J. Lee
Title: Buttons gave my son a blister
Body: It gave my son a blister where the buttons are. I tried it again and it gave him bad red marks. My son is only 8month old.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2018
Author: Jam F
Title: LEAK within first minute...
Body: Unfortunately we were 0/2 with this diaper. Used it twice, and within a minute of putting it on, urine had leaked through the whole thing. Waste of money.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2023
Author: L. Bailey
Title: Runs small
Body: I bought the 0-36m size for my son who is almost 2, weighs about 30 lbs. he is wearing size 2T, 3T is baggy on him.. but the 0-36m size is too small, won’t last us longer then a few weeks. Bummer.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
Author: Sana Vawda
Title: Love it but super small!
Body: I bought a larger size to last my son through the summer but we are still in the spring and we couldn't even get it up his thighs!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
Author: KSU
Title: Very small
Body: Already to tight for my 6 month baby

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
Author: thrillhouse
Title: Too Tight for 1 year old
Body: I bought these when my son started infant swim lessons at 9 months old. Great idea since they're re-usable and environmentally friendly. I imagine our landfills are like 70% diapers. He never once pooped in these so I can't speak to the absorbency and effectiveness at all. Unfortunately they left red marks on his thighs even on the loosest configuration. Will try them again after he thins out as an older toddler or save for next kid who might be less thunderously thighed.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2016
Author: stacy
Title: I love how cute this is
Body: I love how cute this is. The adjustable aspect is awesome as well. However I feel like it was made backwards. I put the tag in the back but it then snaps wrong/backwards. With mine it snaps to the back not to the front like a regular cloth diaper. With my newborn this makes for a difficult time trying to adjust it to fit around his waist. Maybe it is a defective one, but either way I will continue to use it. It does its job.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020
Author: Dee
Title: Just Ok
Body: It’s not at all absorbent. Liquid runs right through it. If you care about that, then I would recommend putting a reusable diaper underneath. However, it’s cute and adjustable. Also it serves its purpose for quick pool dips.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2018
Author: Pauline Ho
Title: Fits smaller then description
Body: Was disappointed because my son is only 27lbs wearing size 4 diaper and this was too tight on him.  I tried it on the largest setting and he said it hurts him because the button by his hip is hurting him and it was too tight.  Was really hoping he would like it because i like the design and it does feel like it’s good material (which is why I gave it 2 stars).  However we have a swim lesson tomorrow and we don’t have a swim diaper for him now.  Just wish the description was more accurate.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
Author: Kate
Title: Irritating buttons
Body: I was excited for a swim diaper like our cloth diapers, but the lining inside this swim diaper is so sheer that the plastic of the buttons underneath rub and irritate baby's belly. There is no way this could possibly be comfortable and there is no way to avoid it as there is no padding there at all. Two stars because the concept is good and the pattern cute. But we are returning and looking for something else that won't hurt my little guy while he plays in the pool.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019
Author: Shopper 0385
Title: Great concept, needs improvement
Body: I appreciate the concept of this diaper. It just didn’t work for us. I tried to use this over the last 1.5 years without The elastic and snaps left red welts on my son. I found it difficult to figure out various snap configurations for him as he grew also. Would be helpful to have more detailed instructions.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2017
Author: Chris B
Title: IPlay was a better choice, but size up on them
Body: Cute. Not made for babies with thick thighs. Would not purchase again. IPlay was a better choice, but size up on them!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2016
Author: Livleen Kahlon
Title: Three Stars
Body: i like the diaper itself but its too tight for my 2.5 yr old. So It didnt work out..

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2017
Author: Norma D
Title: Three Stars
Body: too small for my 30 pound, 14 month old baby.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2017
Author: Vidya
Title: Not sure if it works
Body: The diaper looks great and the quality looks great. however I'm not sure if the swim diaper is supposed to protect the actual diaper from getting wet? My daughters actual diaper got so soaked even with the swim diaper on

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2015
Author: TD
Title: Three Stars
Body: The pants work great, the buttons leave indents on her skin.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2019
Author: Josefsara
Title: Not worthy
Body: I really like it at first, very cute design but first is expensive compared to other brands and after couple times my son use it one of the clips came out.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2016
Author: Nicole Zeig
Title: Why all the snaps?
Body: All the snaps on it are just weird. I still don't understand their purpose.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2018
Author: Emily Brownell
Title: Snap broke after second use. Would not buy again ...
Body: Snap broke after second use. Would not buy again. Its made in China and so you may as well just buy the cheaper version.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2017
Author: ayman
Title: One Star
Body: leaking

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
Author: Mary B
Title: Run very small even with all the adjustments
Body: My grandson is 11 months & 25 lbs. this diaper (24mo( was Way too small) notEven close to fitting him.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
Author: Emma Z Wilson
Title: Pee go right through it.
Body: So my baby just wore this yesterday, good material, love the design, it’s adjustable yay! My husband and I with baby in the pool everything was great until we decide to have a snack, we put our baby in his jumper and all of the sudden there was a puddle of pee, I thought maybe I had forget to order an absorbing pad but I don’t think it says anywhere I need one. That’s the only thing, he hasn’t pooped in it, we’ll see.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
Author: Patricia Rawlings
Title: Runs small
Body: Runs small

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2022
Author: Karlygash
Title: You have to have a diaper on your child
Body: Not waterproof. You have to put diaper.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2022
Author: Samah Y
Title: Doesn’t fit my 9 month old baby.
Body: Should include a setting for a larger size

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020
Author: Realmarcha
Title: Mixed feelings...
Body: As suggested, we continued to check my grandson's swim diaper frequently for a bowel movement and eventually found one and proceeded to change the diaper.  My grandson, in a matter of a couple hours developed a redness and inflammation on his testicles which was very tender to the touch making him show distress by starting to cry.  I immediately put Auquaphor  cream on it and a regular diaper.  We did not allow him back in the pool the rest of the day.  By the next day, with the continued use of the Auguaphor cream, the redness and inflammation disappeared.My mixed feelings are this.  The swim diaper does work as described; the bowel movements do stay in the diaper. One the other hand, the swim diaper can also cause painful irritations to the wearer.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
Author: Ford Family :)
Title: So complicated but so cute
Body: I really think this was a good idea but unfortunately the assembly does require a degree in modern physics and rocket science. We look at ours in my sons swimsuit spot every day when we head to the pool in udder disappointment of ourselves. Maybe if the assembly wasn’t so complicated like label it or something… I don’t know.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
Author: Eileen & RolandEileen & Roland
Title: Not as great as a cloth diaper shell
Body: Quality material and easy to clean, but it's not easy to clip together on my child. I use Grovia shells for cloth diapers and the design is far easier to clip onto my daughter. When you put the swim diaper on you have to stretch the front tabs to the back to connect the front and back. In the Grovia the back has flaps that extend to the front making it easier to clip on and off when changing.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2021
Author: Elizabeth
Title: Could be better
Body: My son wears size 6 diapers, size 3t in pants. These are supposed to grow with him, but the leg holes aren’t nearly stretchy enough to fit him around the thighs. They are absorbent and good everywhere else minus the size. These were supposed to be a 3t,  it got way smaller.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2022
Author: Shwetha
Title: Fitbit not great
Body: It doesn't fit right on my chunky baby even though I ordered acc to size chart mentioned. Not recommended..

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2017
Author: Michael Hawthorne
Title: Too small for my 33lb 3 year old, and poop got into the pool
Body: I'm feeling discouraged.  This diaper is advertised as one size, 8-36lbs.  My son is currently 33lbs, and the swim diaper barely fits him.  He complains that it's too tight, and he's nowhere near potty trained yet.  I'm afraid I don't know what I'll do when I can't fit him in it anymore.  Also, we recently had a mishap in the pool where he was wearing two of these, and pooped and it all washed into the pool and they had to kick everyone out.  I'm hoping it'll work better for my younger son.  But I think I'm going to have to find something else for my 3 year old, and I just don't know what that will be.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021
Author: Slice of Heaven
Title: Smaller than expected
Body: This was almost too small for my 8 mo old son (18 lbs) I was surprised and thought it would be big since the description says it would fit up to like 30 lbs or something

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021
Author: Corey
Title: Way too small for 18-month-old
Body: My son is in size 5 diapers and weighs 28 pounds. This diaper was WAY too small. Couldn’t get his legs through and he is a lean kid. Had to order the larger size, so we’ll see if that fits him.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
Author: Sharen L. Sakel
Title: Small
Body: Too small for our grandson, Bentley.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018
Author: Laura A Firman
Title: Runs Really Small
Body: I bought this diaper for my almost two year old. Unfortunately, is was impossible to snap the diaper, even in the loosest mode. He's ~32 pounds and has some chunky thighs but I wouldn't say unusually large. It seems very well made and it cute. But if you have a child with chunky legs or is on the larger size, I'd recommend giving yourself time to buy/return (or get another swim diaper as a back up) before you need to use it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021
Author: Michael
Title: Cute Diaper Cover for Water Babies!
Body: Adjustable and good product! Could be more padding in the diaper for absorbency, but I'll just layer a normal diaper underneath to prevent accidents!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
Author: Lauren
Title: Is one size fits MOST
Body: I have a 10month old that's almost 26lbs. This was too small for him. Great idea but didn't fit. :(

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Doesn't hold pee
Body: This fit well enough and was relatively easy to figure out how to fit baby. However, the first time we got him in it he peed, and it soaked my swimsuit before we got in the water. There is zero absorbency with this. He hasn't pooped in it yet, but I expect it to work pretty decently for that.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2017
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Very nice quality, but seems tight around the thighs
Body: Very nice quality, but seems tight around the thighs. I can just get the buttons done around her waist and she doesn't complain, but it doesn't look comfortable and I wonder how she would do during a morning/afternoon at the beach. I'm hanging onto it in the hope that it may become more useful in the future (perhaps next summer) as she grows taller and thinner. Seems like it might fit infants or 2-3 year olds best and be less useful for that in-between phase.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
Author: Matthew Urbanek
Title: Too tight around legs
Body: The leg holes are too tight for my toddler despite being adjustable.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2021
Author: Amaz0n Customer
Title: Runs small
Body: Runs small

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021
Author: Doris munafo
Title: Cute but does not hold urine
Body: It does not hold urine went right through it all over my husband

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
Author: Seera Akra
Title: Wrong size
Body: Nothing wrong except that it barely fit my 2.5 year old.. I got frustrated

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2022
Author: Mary Mosby
Title: Not a swim diaper, worthless
Body: This product holds water!!! That’s exactly what it’s not supposed to do. The water it holds weighs the baby down and, when you pull baby out of water, it creates a gap in the legs which allows feces to flow into the pool. A reusable swim diaper should allow water to pass through but not solids. I could have just used my cloth diaper but wanted something that would actually work for a swim diaper to avoid these issues. The diaper is now worthless to me, don’t waste your money.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022
Title: Buttons set through the fabric
Body: As another reviewer wrote, the snaps do show on the inside so they would rub against Baby's tummy. It's a single layer fabric you see. Other than that, these would have been great, but unfortunately I had to return them.
